title: Anybody feel meta overrules skill now?
body:
Yes, abiding by meta will give you an advantage - nothing wrong with this.

However, League used to be a game where if you had mastered a champion, you could overcome the slight advantage meta provided. Not any more.

Meta champions - which there are a few, so I guess you could say fight meta with meta, but that is not the point of this post - are so dominant to the point where they are unbeatable in a vacuum. The only chance you stand is if your opponent is a complete muppet and you're good at your off-meta or slightly-off-meta champion.

Anyone agree?

replies.body:
I mostly agree with Roguestoney, the higher you go the more even and lreliable things are in the realm of game knowledge and mechanical skill so the meta will have more impact there, but that has always been the case.

With a few exceptions of champions that really are just too damn strong in a particular area (lookin' at you Varus) my feeling at the moment isn't that meta is overriding skill atm, but more that it is just more popular. More people are choosing to play meta over what they are better at, or something like that. That's just my feeling.
No. Skill is still generally greater than meta in lower divisions. In higher divisions meta would win more imo...

that said we still have some wackos out there, especially in the higher elos, like tilterella with his full ad sion and raigarak with his support azir/irelia/karthus/literally anything that normally isn't a sup. These guys are next level ignoring the meta in challenger. So much fun to watch their streams and highlights on youtube.

the meta is strong but their is always that instance of a player shining through it and just whooping some ass.

also i feel it keeps the game fresh  when someone just totally owns on an off meta pick. I have a ton of respect for those types of players.
sion support bby cant carry hard enough
i havnt really felt the power gap between a meta champ and a non meta until i had to verse a varus in the peak of lethality as twitch

Considering you could always take the stronger champs and compare to the weaker ones to observe their incredibly obvious theoretical power-gaps, I would say Yes, but hardly anything new really as it's been a significant problem with League for quite some time.

EDIT: As mentioned by Barry, different champ classes would be impacted by this differently (possibility associated withe scale-ability). Though personally I believe this is nevertheless quite a prominent issue across the board with only top lane being somewhat shielded/excluded from this tbh.

I think with ADCs right now yes. If you are not playing MF, Jhin or Varus you are at a disadvantage already. Don't get me wrong, you can still win and do well, but the "lethality adcs" have a distinct advantage atm.

I feel like mid/top/supp you can play anything and get away with it.

Junglers have the top 4-5 which are hard to overcome but most people use them anyway. I've seen plenty of "off meta" like Rammus and Mundo jg do well.
